CUEA – Created in 1952 as the Utility Policy Committee – Incorporated Private Non Profit status 1998 Purpose – Voluntary organization – Focus on all hazard planning, coordination, communication in emergency planning and disaster response
CUEA
– Created in 1952 as the Utility Policy Committee
– Incorporated Private Non Profit status 1998
Purpose
– Voluntary organization
– Focus on all hazard planning, coordination,
communication in emergency planning and
disaster response

– Includes representatives of each infrastructure

CUEA Mission – Contribute to preserving lives, property, and
CUEA Mission C U E A M i s s i o n
– Contribute to preserving lives, property, and

California’s economic infrastructure, by coordinating with member utilities, non member utilities if priorities and information allow, and government agencies in planning for, responding to and recovering from impending, threatening or presenting disasters.
California’s economic infrastructure, by
coordinating with member utilities, non member
utilities if priorities and information allow, and
government agencies in planning for,
responding to and recovering from impending,
threatening or presenting disasters.

www.cueainc.com
www.cueainc.com

CUEA Responsibilities – Promote efficient communications and
CUEA Responsibilities C U E A R e s p o n s i b i l i t i e s
– Promote efficient communications and

cooperation among government agencies and member utilities.
cooperation among government agencies and
member utilities.

– Activate a Utility Operations Center to provide emergency support and response coordination for utilities at the Region Level EOC or State Operations Center, as practicable.

emergency support and response coordination

– Support utility emergency planning, mitigation,

training and education.

CUEA EOC
CUEA EOC

Co-located within CA OES; provides structure to address Utility emergency related issues.
Co-located within CA
OES; provides structure
to address Utility
emergency related
issues.

Senior managers from CA Utilities staff the EOC. CUEA is activated for response and recovery issues The Executive Director may serve as the utilities liason to CA OES through the state operations center.

CUEA Mission
CUEA Mission

Provides structure for efficient communications and coordination among government agencies, public and private utilities throughout Calif. Focused on emergency-related response, restoration, operational and business continuity for following California utilities: – Gas – Electric – Water – Wastewater – Telecommunications – Pipeline
Provides structure for efficient
communications and coordination among c o m m u n i c a t i o n s
a n d
c o o r d i n a t i o n a m o n g
government agencies, public and private utilities
throughout Calif.

continuity for following California utilities: c o n t i n u i t y f o r
